info.name: Paris icons [Tumblr post icons]
info.description: Tumblr 'new post' icons for your dashboard. "Gypsum plaster, or plaster of Paris, is produced by heating gypsum to about 150 Â°C. When the dry plaster powder is mixed with water, it re-forms into gypsum. A large gypsum deposit at Montmartre in Paris led "calcined gypsum" (roasted gypsum or gypsum plaster) to be commonly known as 'plaster of Paris'." *
